p: The compound n-hexadecanoic acid is a common fatty acid that has been found in abundance in plants [ 70]. Previous studies reported that n-hexadecanoic acid selectively inhibits DNA topoisomerase-I and thus prevents the proliferation of human fibroblast cells [ 71]. Ravi and Krishnan [ 72] found that Kigelia pinnata leaves' crude extracts resulted in identification of n-hexadecanoic acid and showed significant cytotoxicity against human colorectal carcinoma cells (HCT-116). Nguyen et al. 2011 [ 41] reported that fatty acids with strong a-glucosidase-inhibitory activity, 7(Z)-octadecenoic acid and 7(Z) and 10(Z)-octadecadienoic acid, were purified and identified from sea cucumber. Another FA, 1,2-benzenedicarboxylic acid, mono(2-ethylhexyl) ester (BMEH) is known for antifungal, antidiabetic, anticancer, and antioxidant activities and as a potent antimicrobial agent [ 73, 74]. Selvakumar et al. 2019 [ 75] reported that BMEH isolated from marine Streptomyces sp. VITJS4 exhibited in vitro anticancer potential against liver (HepG2) cancer cells.
